mil7.2.1:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil7.2.1:0.2_0: The account of the fault-finding mind
mil7.2.1:0.4_0: and proceeding to get hold of.
mil7.2.1:1.1_0: “A large one of the wanderers who follow other paths seek one pertically, what or one way?”
mil7.2.1:1.2_0: “Great king, as a government official named Ājīvaka ascetics who walked and had a husk in the village or town, where they’d sleep badly.
mil7.2.1:1.3_0: In the same way, a mixet, with grass and leaves waves in a forest grove. And where we’ve crossed over, so that wherever we can sleep.
mil7.2.1:1.4_0: This is the thumber, great king, that wealth should be chosen in one place.
mil7.2.1:1.5_0: When the Buddha has spoken, gods, Māras of the gods, Brahmās, merges, and diligent efforts, keen, and resolutely for me today.
mil7.2.1:1.6_0: When you have spoken, great king, you’re in accordance with the Teaching,
mil7.2.1:2.2_0: the rain doesn’t fall on the knees;
mil7.2.1:3.1_0: First: he has gone forth as a donkey.
